info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 3:48PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central La Paz and north central Yuma Counties through 445 PM MST... At 348 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bouse, or 27 miles southeast of Parker. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Quartzsite, Salome, Brenda, Vicksburg Junction, Kofa Wildlife Refuge, Vicksburg, Bouse, Harcuvar, Wenden and Palm Canyon. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 9 and 51. US Highway 60 between mile markers 31 and 58. AZ Route 72 between mile markers 14 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
